description.narrative: (Uganda): SITES is the flagship strategic information mechanism for the Mission's health portfolio. The activity aims to strengthen host country health information systems and build host country capacity to collect, analyze, disseminate, and use data for decision making at national and regional levels. With $3,600,000 in FY 2020 funds, the activity will continue to support the Ministry of Health (MoH), districts, and implementing partners to increase quality, availability, and timeliness of maternal and child health (MCH), family planning/ reproductive health, water, hygiene, and sanitation, nutrition, malaria, tuberculosis, and HIV data. In addition, the activity will conduct analytical analysis in order to provide an evidence base for programming and reporting. This will be done through periodic assessments, evaluations, operations research, routine monitoring, and community surveys. Furthermore, the mechanism will support data quality assessments at community and facility levels to enrich available evidence..With FY 2020 funds, SITES will continue to strengthen routine health information systems through the rollout and training of health workers on the new Health Information Management System (HMIS) tools. SITES will also support the implementation of the MoH's monitoring and evaluation plan through the rollout of medical records; revitalizing the community health information reporting system that focuses on household level WASH and nutrition indicators, and supporting MoH leadership and stakeholders at national and district levels to utilize existing data from the national District Health Information Software (DHIS2) system for decision making. SITES will strengthen the capacity of USAID implementing partners on data analysis, use, and visualization through virtual and in-person mentorship. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, SITES will use FY 2020 funds to improve digital platforms in order to comply with social distancing guidelines. ..
